Description of incident: A security company searching the web for sensitive data uncovered personally identifiable information from IndyMac Bank and Indy Mac Resources employees, and possibly others associated with the firms.  IndyMac Bank failed sometime around July of 2008.  The information is related to IndyMac employee pension benefits analysis and appears to have been placed on a public web server by an employee of a contractor for IndyMac.  People who were employed by either IndyMac firm between January 1, 1999 and January 1, 2005 had their names, Social Security numbers, dates of birth, earnings, hire dates, and other employment related information exposed.  It was available as early as January of 2007 and as recently as December of 2011.
